q: United Center-- as the Detroit Pistons trounced the Chicago Bulls, 110-83.`` Thats the most points I've ever scored,'' Jerry Stackhouse said, who is the NBA's second-leading scorer behind former teammate Allen Iverson . This is the highest level of basketball that you can play and I can say that I did this. It is definitely something I will remember for a long time. And I really think I can do it again. Michael Jordan did most of his prolific scoring in Chicago Stadium prior to his first retirement and never scored more than 55 points in the United Center, which opened in 1994. After paying his time in prison, Michael Vick has gotten a new endorsement. The Philadelphia Eagles' quarterback has signed a deal with Unequal Technologies. The CEO , Rob Vito, of Unequal Technologies said, We're real excited about it. Michael Vick is good people. He paid his dues. Barack Obama reached out to him. He deserves an opportunity. This is what makes America so great. He's moved forward. He's a whole other person. Unequal Technologies are the creators of sports pads. His chapter is titled Trust me, your idea is worthless. The point of the chapter is that ideas are just the starting point and it's everything that comes after the idea that really matters. military for the future.( AP| KENNETH LAMBERT) to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. It is, of course, a logical fallacy to multiply categories beyond necessity, but it's one Donald Rumsfeld has rhetorically mastered to create a self-conscious reputation as a fearless questioner of received truths, one he's

What: Barbara Walters , who had her own surgery to repair a faulty heart valve last year, addresses heart disease and the fear many have of a heart operation in A Matter of Life and Death. She talks to former Bill Clinton , David Letterman , Robin Williams and Regis Philbin , celebrities who've had heart surgeries. She also talks to doctors, including her own, about prevention and the warning signs of heart trouble.
